result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian T Fuller #649495 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: NOTICE TO DISTRICT ATTORNEY ON PETITION FOR SENTENCE ADJUSTMENT
Revoked-sentenced to Prison

08:32 AM Defendant Brian T Fuller in court with attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick.  Defendant Brian T Fuller in custody.  Lester H Liptak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CF206, 16CF125.  No evidence by the State, Atty K speaks of SS/Disability pending for DE.  Atty Liptak enters sentencing argument, DE will have credit for 434 days in 15CF206 and 295 days in 16CF125.  Atty K enters argument on sentencing, asking for time served on both cases.  DE makes a statement to the court.  

15CF206-Court will order 6 years, 3 in/3 out, will have credit for 434 days.  DE is eligible for CIP,SAP
16CF125-Court will order 4 years, 2 in/2 out, will have credit for 295 days.  DE is eligible for CIP,SAP.  Reduce unpaid court obligations to civil judgment. Sentences will be concurrent.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 20, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 18, 2018 at 11:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 11, 2018 at 09:30 am.

Case settlement

Defendant Brian T Fuller in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz.  Defendant Brian T Fuller in custody.  James D Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CF1,16CF39, 16CM1.  State recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  Court will accept the recommendations of the parties, DE has credit for 139 days, Court will order as follows:

16CF1-DRI

16CM1-NC-G

15CF206-NC-G

16CF39-DRI

16CF125-Ct 1, NC
                Ct's 2,3,4-DRI

Court will order Sentence withheld, 3 years probation,  120 days jail (served 139) with huber,  provide a DNA sample/surcharge, CC.

Defendant Brian T Fuller in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz appearing telephonic.  Defendant Brian T Fuller in custody.  James D Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CF125, 16CM1, 16CF1, 16CF39.  DE has appt Sept 29th in Eau Claire, Atty asking for furlough to attend this appt.  State does not object, but requests that DE/Atty provide to the court the time of appt and the time they left the appt. Mother will provide to the jail time verification of both arrival and departure time for appt.  Bond will be modified for this appt only.   DE must go directly to the appt and return directly from the appt.  Atty wishes to address the issue of bond, wishes modification to sign bond.  State objects.  Court will deny request.
Dated 9/08/16 from Atty Kelz to Judge Anderson, with had written notes on letter.
Motion hearing on September 19, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Defendant's Motion to request furlough, filed by Atty Kelz
Defendant's Notice of Motion to Request Furlough, filed by Atty Karl Kelz
Oral ruling on November 14, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Brian T Fuller in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz.  Defendant Brian T Fuller in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CF1, 16CF39, 16CF125, 16CM1.  16CF125-PH-State calls Deputy Dan Glaze, oath given.  Direct by the State.  Cross by Atty Kelz.  Witness dismissed.  State rests, Court will bind DE over, probable cause found, bind over for JT.  Will proceed to arraignment.  Waive reading of information,enter plea of NG.  MH in 15CF206-Court will finish reading briefs.  Will give oral ruling on briefs, Atty may appear telephonic, 11-14-16 @ 3:30PM.  Atty would like to address the issue of bond, DE would like to do an evulation at Aurora but needs to be released to do this.  Mother will make arrangements for appt and contact the jail when made, DE will be released for the day only,  DE will also be allowed to go to Rice Lake for an assessment in September for a one day furlough. DE told the consequence of not returning to jail if allowed release for these matters.  Mother will transport for the appointments, and return DE to jail after each appointment.
